title: Infant of Prague Novena
description: This devotion comes from a lovely statue of the child Jesus, said to have once belonged to St. Teresa of Avila, holding a globe with a cross on top, representing Christ‚Äôs dominion over the whole world.

üì± 

@media (max-width: 768px) { #branch-daily-prayer-9 .notice--info { padding: 16px 14px !important; } #branch-daily-prayer-9 a > div:last-child { padding: 16px 20px !important; font-size: 1.1em !important; } }

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O Jesus, who has said ask and you shall receive, seek and you shall find, knock and it shall be opened to you, through the intercession of Mary, Your Most Holy Mother, I knock, I seek and I ask that my prayer may be granted. (mention request here‚Ä¶) O Jesus, who has said all that you ask of the Father in My Name, He will grant you, through the intercession of Mary, Your Most Holy Mother, I humbly and urgently ask Your Father in Thy Name, that my prayer be granted. (mention request again) O Jesus, who has said, ‚ÄúHeaven and Earth shall pass away, but My word shall not pass‚Äù, through the intercession of Mary, Your Most Holy Mother, I place my confidence in You that my prayer will be granted. (mention request again)

Divine Infant Jesus, I know You love me and would never leave me. I thank You for Your close Presence in my life. Miraculous Infant, I believe in Your promise of peace, blessings, and freedom from want. I place every need and care in Your hands. Lord Jesus, may I always trust in Your generous mercy and love. I want to honor and praise You, now and forever. Amen. Infant of Prague, have mercy on us

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Answered Prayers From This Novena

Suddenly i been put into top management group hopefully this will be good opportunity for me to have balance financial.

from J.S.

I had a toxic relationship that almost ruined me. I was not able to get out. It felt like I had been bewitched to stay in that horrible relationship.

My despair made me start a Triduum to the Infant of Prague. Immediately after I had finished it (the next day after finishing the Triduum), the relationship was ended.

I felt relief and, although hurt and devastated inside, I knew God had had pity on me and released me from that diabolical relationship. Blessed be the Son of God!

from N.M.

I was requesting to get a job in Canada and my request was granted, Today was the 9th day of my Novena .Thanks be to God. Today 24th Dec 2024 I got a call from the company that you have been selected and come and join them on Jan 02nd 2025, and I was waiting for that call üìûfor more than one month God is so loving and caring for me in all my difficulty.He never left me alone when I am weak. ASK AND U SHALL RECEIVE THAT S GOD ALMIGHTY Anyways thanks be to Prague of Infant Jesus my God for granting me the request and giving me this opportunity and I will be thanking and praising you God everytime and everyday ‚õ™ ‚ù§. I love you Jesus I adore you Jesus I worship you Jesus Amen God bless you

from A.B.

I prayed to St. Rita and Infant Jesus of Prague for my driving license and I passed my driving test today.

from C.P.

After praying the Infant of Prague novena, I was called for a job interview and passed well. God blessed me with a permanent job. I‚Äôm forever grateful to God.

Hi my sister was blessed financially, and I was exempted from my house taxes.

These were truly two blessings that I received from praying this beautiful powerful Infant of Prague Novena.

I love Baby Jesus so so much. I thank the Holy Spirit for Jesus.

I love God, Our Beautiful Blessed Mother, all of the Archangels, Angels, and Saints forever and ever.

from M.J.

I have been praying everyday for a permanent job.

I‚Äôve turned to St. Rita last year and twice I did my novena. One of the prayers I had was for my eldest son to find a job.

He did and now he‚Äôs an intern with a large accounting firm of Australia.

I also prayed for myself, to get a permanent job. There were times I wanted to give up. But I held on with my trust and faith.

I entrusted St. Rita and my three other favorite saints with my prayer, including the Infant of Prague.

And called Mama Mary, Papa Jesus, and Se√±or Santo Nino to help me.

And with all my heart and gratitude I am here to declare that God, Mama Mary, Se√±or Sto. Nino listened and together with the intercession of St. Rita and my other saints.

Glory be to God in the highest! I have now a permanent job!

Every day my heart will sing glory and be thankful for this miracle disguised as a blessing.

from L.H.

I am from Nigeria. Whenever l pray the novena to the Infant of Prague over the past 25 years, something spectacular happens in my life.

My prayer intentions will be answered. This novena has never failed me.

from U.O.

I am 74 and grew up as a child in Dublin, Ireland.

My mother had a small statue that she kept on the mantelpiece in our living room.

She would put small money like three pence or sixpence under it and whenever it would multiply she would give half to the church of Saint Kevin‚Äôs where we attended.

I moved last year next to Our Lady of Victory Church in Baltimore. When they saw a video on the Infant of Prague that I had made and heard the story they accepted a 24 inch beautiful statue of the Infant that I donated in memory of my mom.

It will have a plaque bearing her name and a life-long prayer. What joy, by God‚Äôs grace, through that video.

My YouTube channel is Hanburycross.com. I have many videos for over 100 saints.

~ L.G.

More About the Infant of Prague

What Is the Significance of the Infant of Prague?

The Infant of Prague is a lovely statue of the child Jesus holding a globe with a cross on top, representing Christ‚Äôs dominion over the whole world. It is a powerful devotion in the Catholic Church.

This wax-coated statue is located in the Discalced Carmelite Church of Our Lady Victorious in Mal√° Strana, Prague, Czech Republic.

Catholics believe that the statue once belonged to Saint Teresa of √Åvila. In 1628 it was donated to the Carmelites by Princess Polyxena of Lobkowicz.

Pope Leo XIII and Pope Pius X approved the devotion, making it both a sodality and then the Confraternity of the Infant Jesus of Prague.

Pope Pius XI crowned it on September 27th, 1924, and then Pope Benedict XVI did the same thing during his Apostolic visit to the Czech Republic on September 26th, 2009.

Those devoted to the Infant of Prague follow the traditional promise that is given: ‚ÄúThe more you will honour me, the more I will bless you.‚Äù

The child Jesus‚Äô right hand is giving a blessing with his first two fingers representing the two natures of Christ and his folded thumb and last two fingers touching to represent the unity of the Holy Trinity. This is a similar symbolism as is found in many Eastern Christian icons.
